diagnosis.final_diagnosis: Mandibular nerve palsy secondary to Lyme disease
diagnosis.differential_diagnosis: Surgical neuropraxia, facial nerve division due to lifting or liposuction procedures
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The patient presented with complete paralysis of the left mandibular branch of the facial nerve after abdominal liposuction with normal neurologic evaluation and MRI scan. A history of a tick bite and weakly positive Lyme disease tests suggested neuroborreliosis as the cause of the palsy, which resolved after treatment with ceftriaxone.
